intro: Hieracium anceps, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium anceps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
